article.headline: Oral Roberts 75, UMKC 47
article.story: KANSAS CITY, Mo. (AP) -- Four Oral Roberts players scored in double figures Thursday night as the Golden Eagles rolled over Missouri-Kansas City 75-47. Oral Roberts (13-5, 8-0) won its seventh straight game and sits atop the Summit League standings. UMKC's 47 points were the lowest output of the season for the Kangaroos (7-14, 2-6), and the 28-point defeat was their biggest losing margin. No. 2 Kansas and Missouri both managed to beat UMKC by only 23. Oral Roberts trailed once, on a 3-pointer by UMKC's Brian Gettinger 1:24 into the game that made the score 3-2. By halftime, though, the Golden Eagles had built a 42-19 lead. The biggest margin came with 4:48 left in the game on a basket by Andre Hardy that made it 71-35. Adam Liberty led Oral Roberts with 16 points, Robert Jarvis and Moses Ehambe had 12 each and Shawn King added 11. Nathan Balch was the only Kangaroo in double figures with a career-high 12 points.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
